node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.title: Margarita Season: Scotch Bonnet and Grapefruit Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.text: Tiffanie Barriere (@thedrinkingcoach) shows us her own version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireUS. Tiffanie makes a strawberry and black peppercorn syrup for a sweet and spicy G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Black Pepper G+T

node.text: #Ad Esther Choi (@choibites), chef/owner of @mokbar_nyc, is showing us how to make a mandu stir-fry with lots of vegetables and of course, @bibigoUSA’s mandu.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on July 30, 2021. May be an image of dessert and indoor.

node.text: Let this (very hot) summer be the season of icebox cakes. This yummy treat “is perfect for summer because you don’t have to turn on your oven,” says baker @samanthaseneviratne. In her recipe, store-bought ginger cookies soften into layers of tender cake surrounded by loads of raspberries and caramel cream. Once it's built, all you have to do is chill it, top it with more raspberries, and enjoy! Head to the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @tripleppp

Photo by bonappetitmag on July 30, 2021. May be an image of dessert.
Photo by bonappetitmag on July 29, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Oyster sauce is something we always have in our fridge door. It’s packed with umami yet it is rarely overpowering, so it adds tons of depth to a stir-fry like this one. Serve this chicken and corn combination with rice and top it off with some fresh cilantro. No fresh corn at the market? Swap in peppers, peas, mushrooms, or summer squash. Click the link in our bio to make this all-around incredibly delicious dish. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @curlygirlcooks 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on July 28, 2021. May be an illustration.

node.text: Diagnosed with minimally-speaking autism and apraxia at age three, contributor Danny Whitty lost the ability to speak shortly after it arrived. “For decades, I was unable to physically express my thoughts and feelings beyond a handful of memorized phrases,” he writes. “I had a rich universe inside me, but no way to share it.” But the rich and alluring pages of food magazines offered a refuge from those daily struggles, representing spaces of community and joy where he could belong. Eventually, he was inspired to start cooking in the hopes that, through food, he could communicate with his family and friends how much they meant to him. Read Whitty’s story at the link in our bio to learn more. 🎨: Martina Fischmeister

node.text: Sure, you could make phyllo dough at home, but the store-bought version is just as good (and a fraction of the effort). @samanthaseneviratne uses it to make the Greek dessert galatopita. Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in our bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on July 22, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: It's hard to think of fried shrimp without also picturing gloopy batter and bubbling, splattering oil, which is why Joy Cho (@joycho_pastry) had mentally filed away crispy shrimp under "things I enjoy but definitely won't be cooking at home." That is until she developed a method that got a similar result—golden, crispy shrimp—without deep-frying, that only required one pantry ingredient: cornstarch. Read more at the link in our bio. 📷 @isa.zapata, 🍴 @rice.isnice

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Chef Sheldon Simeon (@chefwonder) is an entrepreneurial guy, almost to a fault. Between doing a run on @bravotopchef’s 10th season, opening (and sometimes leaving) restaurants on Maui, and publishing his acclaimed cookbook Cook Real Hawai’i (cowritten with @g_sny). he’s always working on something. “I don’t think I’d be a chef if I didn’t grow up in Hawai’i,” Simeon told restaurants editor Elyse Inamine (@elysei). “As crazy as it sounds, aloha spirit is a real thing. It touches you. It makes you want to rep Hawai’i hard.” Read about how Simeon’s not just bringing attention to Hawai’i’s cuisine but redefining it, at the link in our bio. 📷: Kevin J. Miyazaki/Courtesy Penguin Random House, Marylane Studios

node.text: Green goddess dressing doubles as a marinade AND a sauce for these juicy grilled chicken thighs. Use whatever tender herb or dairy product you have, but whatever you do, don’t skip the anchovies! Senior food editor @ andybaraghani says, “They will make the chicken savory, delicious, and more chicken-y.” We believe him. Grab his recipe in our bio now. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @tripleppp

node.text: When grilling a whole chicken, we stand by two tried-and-true methods: spatchcocking the bird so it cooks evenly and seasoning it with dry rub so you get flavor into every nook and cranny. This recipe from assistant food editor @thelescook checks those boxes, with a foolproof grilling method for the spatchcocked bird and an umami-packed dry rub (five-spice and MSG!). We’re making it all summer, and you should, too. Grab the recipe link in our bio. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @tripleppp
